Jesus' Victory Over Sin and Death: Jesus' Victory Over Sin and Death
Easter is about more than eggs and bunni: Easter is about more than eggs and bunnies—it's about Jesus and His amazing love for us. He died on the cross for our sins and rose from the dead, showing His power over sin and death. Because of Him, we can have forgiveness and the promise of eternal life. Easter is a time to celebrate this great hope and God's incredible gift to us.
How can I trust in God's sovereignty whe: How can I trust in God's sovereignty when the world feels so chaotic?
Even in times of chaos and uncertainty,: Even in times of chaos and uncertainty, we can trust in God's sovereignty because:
God remains in control even when circums: God remains in control even when circumstances feel out of control
His purposes are higher than our underst: His purposes are higher than our understanding
He promises to work all things for good: He promises to work all things for good for those who love Him
The Bible shows countless examples of Go: The Bible shows countless examples of God bringing order from chaos
Why is Easter the most important Christi: Why is Easter the most important Christian holiday?
Easter is central to Christian faith bec: Easter is central to Christian faith because:
It marks Jesus' resurrection, proving Hi: It marks Jesus' resurrection, proving His victory over death
It fulfills Old Testament prophecies abo: It fulfills Old Testament prophecies about the Messiah
It demonstrates God's power to give new: It demonstrates God's power to give new life
It provides hope for our own resurrectio: It provides hope for our own resurrection and eternal life
What happened during the three days betw: What happened during the three days between Jesus' death and resurrection?
The Bible tells us several key events oc: The Bible tells us several key events occurred:
Jesus' body was placed in a tomb and gua: Jesus' body was placed in a tomb and guarded by Roman soldiers
His followers mourned and waited in unce: His followers mourned and waited in uncertainty
According to Scripture, He descended to: According to Scripture, He descended to the realm of the dead
On the third day, He rose victorious ove: On the third day, He rose victorious over death
\"Where, O death, is your victory? Where: "Where, O death, is your victory? Where, O death, is your sting?" The sting of death is sin, and the power of sin is the law. But thanks be to God! He gives us the victory through our Lord Jesus Christ.
Want to grow deep in your understanding: Want to grow deep in your understanding of the Bible?
Last hour of Jesus' life from criminal's: Last hour of Jesus' life from criminal's point of view
A condemned thief watches in horror as J: A condemned thief watches in horror as Jesus is brutally flogged in Pilate's courtyard, memories of his own crimes flooding his mind. Why would they punish an innocent man? The roar of the crowd seals their fate—crucifixion. Forced to carry their crosses to Golgotha, he stumbles beside Jesus, the weight of his past and his sentence crushing him. As nails pierce flesh and the sky darkens, he makes a desperate plea—could this truly be the Messiah? In his final moments, Jesus gives him an unexpected promise: Today, you will be with me in paradise. Watch as this powerful moment unfolds.
Why would Jesus forgive a criminal so ea: Why would Jesus forgive a criminal so easily?
Jesus' forgiveness is a demonstration of: Jesus' forgiveness is a demonstration of God's grace and mercy. The thief on the cross recognized Jesus' innocence and divinity, humbly asking to be remembered in His kingdom. Jesus' response shows:
Salvation is based on faith, not deeds: Salvation is based on faith, not deeds
God's mercy extends to all, even the wor: God's mercy extends to all, even the worst sinners
Jesus came to save the lost, including c: Jesus came to save the lost, including criminals and outcasts
Grace is freely given to those who since: Grace is freely given to those who sincerely seek it
If Jesus was innocent, why didn't he sav: If Jesus was innocent, why didn't he save himself instead of accepting death?
Jesus willingly accepted death because i: Jesus willingly accepted death because it was part of God's plan for redemption. His sacrifice was necessary to fulfill prophecy and bring salvation. Key reasons include:
His death fulfilled Old Testament prophe: His death fulfilled Old Testament prophecies (Isaiah 53)
He took on the punishment for humanity's: He took on the punishment for humanity's sins
By not saving Himself, He demonstrated H: By not saving Himself, He demonstrated His ultimate love and obedience to God
His resurrection proved His victory over: His resurrection proved His victory over sin and death
What does it really mean to be 'in parad: What does it really mean to be 'in paradise' with Jesus?
Being in paradise with Jesus means etern: Being in paradise with Jesus means eternal life in the presence of God. The thief on the cross was assured of his place with Jesus in heaven because of his faith. Important aspects of this promise include:
It signifies immediate presence with Chr: It signifies immediate presence with Christ after death
It confirms salvation through faith alon: It confirms salvation through faith alone
It offers hope of eternal joy and peace: It offers hope of eternal joy and peace
Jesus' words affirm the reality of life: Jesus' words affirm the reality of life beyond this world
Truly I tell you, today you will be with: Truly I tell you, today you will be with me in paradise.
Father, forgive them, for they do not kn: Father, forgive them, for they do not know what they are doing.
But he was pierced for our transgression: But he was pierced for our transgressions, he was crushed for our iniquities; the punishment that brought us peace was on him, and by his wounds we are healed.
Go on this adventure to time travel to t: Go on this adventure to time travel to the 1st century and check out other theories for Jesus's empty tomb.
Why is Easter celebrated with bunnies?: Why is Easter celebrated with bunnies?
Why Did Jesus Have to Die?: Why Did Jesus Have to Die?
God created humans to be spiritually and: God created humans to be spiritually and relationally connected with Him, but how can we keep God's commands? How can we live without shame? We can't restore ourselves to honor. It would seem we're doomed, except God doesn't want His creation to die. He is merciful and loving, and wants us to be restored, living with Him in full life.
Jesus' death was necessary to fulfill Go: Jesus' death was necessary to fulfill God's plan of redemption. Because of sin, humanity was separated from God, but Jesus' sacrifice provided the way for reconciliation. Here's why His death was essential:
Sin creates a barrier between us and God: Sin creates a barrier between us and God
God's justice requires a payment for sin: God's justice requires a payment for sin
Jesus, as the perfect sacrifice, took ou: Jesus, as the perfect sacrifice, took our place
Through His death, we receive forgivenes: Through His death, we receive forgiveness and restoration
If God is loving, why didn't He just for: If God is loving, why didn't He just forgive sin without Jesus' sacrifice?
God's love and justice go hand in hand. While He desires to forgive, He also upholds justice. Jesus' sacrifice was the ultimate expression of both:
Forgiveness requires a cost, and Jesus p: Forgiveness requires a cost, and Jesus paid that cost
His death satisfied God's justice while: His death satisfied God's justice while showing His mercy
Through Jesus, God demonstrated His love: Through Jesus, God demonstrated His love for humanity
His sacrifice allows us to be restored w: His sacrifice allows us to be restored without compromising divine justice
How does Jesus' death affect our relatio: How does Jesus' death affect our relationship with God?
Jesus' death and resurrection opened the: Jesus' death and resurrection opened the way for us to be reconciled with God. Through Him, we can:
Experience forgiveness and freedom from: Experience forgiveness and freedom from sin
Have direct access to God through Christ: Have direct access to God through Christ
Receive the gift of eternal life: Receive the gift of eternal life
Live in restored relationship with our C: Live in restored relationship with our Creator
But God demonstrates his own love for us: But God demonstrates his own love for us in this: While we were still sinners, Christ died for us.
For God so loved the world that he gave: For God so loved the world that he gave his one and only Son, that whoever believes in him shall not perish but have eternal life.
He himself bore our sins in his body on: He himself bore our sins in his body on the cross, so that we might die to sins and live for righteousness; by his wounds you have been healed.
Want to understand more about Jesus' sac: Want to understand more about Jesus' sacrifice?
Did Jesus Come Back From the Dead?: Did Jesus Come Back From the Dead?
Jesus told people that he would die and: Jesus told people that he would die and then come back to life. This short film explains the details surrounding Jesus' death and resurrection. His closest followers struggled to believe, but eyewitnesses confirmed the truth: He rose again. The news of His resurrection spread across the world, changing lives forever. Because of these witnesses, we can have confidence in the reality of Jesus' resurrection.
How do we know Jesus really died and ros: How do we know Jesus really died and rose again?
There is strong historical and biblical: There is strong historical and biblical evidence for Jesus' death and resurrection:
Roman soldiers confirmed His death befor: Roman soldiers confirmed His death before burying Him
Jesus' tomb was sealed and guarded: Jesus' tomb was sealed and guarded
Hundreds of witnesses saw Jesus alive af: Hundreds of witnesses saw Jesus alive after His resurrection
His disciples, once afraid, boldly preac: His disciples, once afraid, boldly preached and died for this truth
Why is the resurrection of Jesus importa: Why is the resurrection of Jesus important?
The resurrection is central to Christian: The resurrection is central to Christian faith because:
It proves Jesus' victory over sin and de: It proves Jesus' victory over sin and death
It fulfills prophecies about the Messiah: It fulfills prophecies about the Messiah
It confirms that Jesus is the Son of God: It confirms that Jesus is the Son of God
It gives believers hope of eternal life: It gives believers hope of eternal life with Him
How should we respond to Jesus' death an: How should we respond to Jesus' death and resurrection?
Jesus' resurrection calls for a personal: Jesus' resurrection calls for a personal response. We can:
Believe in Him as our Savior and Lord: Believe in Him as our Savior and Lord
Repent from sin and follow His teachings: Repent from sin and follow His teachings
Share the good news of His resurrection: Share the good news of His resurrection with others
Want to understand more about the resurr: Want to understand more about the resurrection?
The Story: How It All Began and How It W: The Story: How It All Began and How It Will Never End
The Story is a short film of how everyth: The Story is a short film of how everything began and how it can never end. This film shares the overarching story of the Bible, a story that redeems all stories and brings new life through salvation in Jesus alone. It answers life's biggest questions: Where did we come from? What went wrong? Is there any hope? And what does the future hold?
Where did everything come from? Is there: Where did everything come from? Is there a purpose to life?
The Bible teaches that everything began: The Bible teaches that everything began with God, the Creator of the universe. He spoke everything into existence with purpose and design. Humanity was created in His image to live in harmony with Him, each other, and creation.
God created the world out of love and or: God created the world out of love and order
Everything was originally perfect, witho: Everything was originally perfect, without pain or suffering
Humans were designed to have a personal: Humans were designed to have a personal relationship with God
If God is good, why is there so much suf: If God is good, why is there so much suffering in the world?
Suffering exists because sin entered the: Suffering exists because sin entered the world when humanity chose to rebel against God. This disobedience broke the original perfection, introducing death, pain, and separation from God.
Sin brought suffering, brokenness, and d: Sin brought suffering, brokenness, and death
We all contribute to the problem of sin: We all contribute to the problem of sin
Despite this, God did not abandon humani: Despite this, God did not abandon humanity—He provided a way for restoration
Is there any hope for the world to be ma: Is there any hope for the world to be made right again?
Yes! God sent Jesus as the rescuer. Jesu: Yes! God sent Jesus as the rescuer. Jesus lived a perfect life, died on the cross to pay for sin, and rose from the dead to defeat death itself. Through Him, we can be restored to God and experience a new life.
His resurrection proves His power over d: His resurrection proves His power over death
Those who trust in Jesus receive new lif: Those who trust in Jesus receive new life and a restored relationship with God
What will happen in the future? Is there: What will happen in the future? Is there life after death?
According to the Bible, God has promised: According to the Bible, God has promised a future where He will restore everything. Those who trust in Jesus will live forever with Him in a perfect, renewed world. Sin, suffering, and death will be no more.
God will create a new heaven and a new e: God will create a new heaven and a new earth
There will be no more pain, suffering, o: There will be no more pain, suffering, or death
Jesus will return to judge the living an: Jesus will return to judge the living and the dead
Everyone must decide how they will respo: Everyone must decide how they will respond to this truth
In the beginning, God created the heaven: In the beginning, God created the heavens and the earth.
For all have sinned and fall short of th: For all have sinned and fall short of the glory of God, and all are justified freely by His grace through the redemption that came by Christ Jesus.
He will wipe every tear from their eyes. There will be no more death or mourning or crying or pain, for the old order of things has passed away.
Want to explore life's biggest questions: Want to explore life's biggest questions?
Mary Magdalene: A Life Transformed by Je: Mary Magdalene: A Life Transformed by Jesus
Mary Magdalene's life was dramatically t: Mary Magdalene's life was dramatically transformed by Jesus, the man who would change the world forever. Once an outcast, she became one of His most devoted followers. In this animated short film, witness the life of Jesus through her eyes—from her redemption to the moment she became the first to witness His resurrection.
In what ways do you identify with the ma: In what ways do you identify with the main character, Mary Magdalene?
Mary Magdalene's story is one of transfo: Mary Magdalene's story is one of transformation and redemption. Like many of us, she carried a past filled with struggles, but Jesus freed her and gave her a new purpose. Her story teaches us:
Jesus offers redemption regardless of ou: Jesus offers redemption regardless of our past
Faith in Christ brings healing and purpo: Faith in Christ brings healing and purpose
God calls the least expected to be His w: God calls the least expected to be His witnesses
Why do you think the elders didn't appro: Why do you think the elders didn't approve of Jesus?
The religious leaders opposed Jesus beca: The religious leaders opposed Jesus because His teachings challenged their authority and traditions. Key reasons include:
He welcomed sinners and outcasts, disrup: He welcomed sinners and outcasts, disrupting social norms
His claim to be the Son of God threatene: His claim to be the Son of God threatened their power
He emphasized mercy over legalism, anger: He emphasized mercy over legalism, angering those who relied on the law
His miracles and growing influence unset: His miracles and growing influence unsettled their control over the people
After his resurrection, why do you think: After his resurrection, why do you think Jesus chose to speak first with Mary?
Jesus' first appearance to Mary Magdalen: Jesus' first appearance to Mary Magdalene was deeply significant. It showed:
His care for those the world overlooked: His care for those the world overlooked
The importance of faith and devotion ove: The importance of faith and devotion over status
That women played a vital role in His mi: That women played a vital role in His ministry and message
How a transformed life can become a powe: How a transformed life can become a powerful testimony
And also some women who had been cured o: And also some women who had been cured of evil spirits and diseases: Mary (called Magdalene) from whom seven demons had come out.
Jesus said to her, \"Mary.\" She turned: Jesus said to her, "Mary." She turned toward him and cried out in Aramaic, "Rabboni!" (which means "Teacher").
Now when Jesus was risen early the first: Now when Jesus was risen early the first day of the week, he appeared first to Mary Magdalene, out of whom he had cast seven devils.
Want to deepen your understanding of Jes: Want to deepen your understanding of Jesus' life?
What's your next step of faith?: What's your next step of faith?

Title: Title
We believe film is the most dynamic way: We believe film is the most dynamic way to hear and see the greatest story ever lived — so we are driven to bring Christ-centered video to the ends of the earth.
Watch, learn and share the gospel in ove: Watch, learn and share the gospel in over 2000 languages
With 70% of the world not being able to: With 70% of the world not being able to speak English, there is a huge opportunity for the gospel to spread to unreached places. We have a vision to make it easier to watch, download and share Christian videos with people in their native heart language.
Jesus Film Project is a Christian minist: Jesus Film Project is a Christian ministry with a vision to reach the world with the gospel of Jesus Christ through evangelistic videos. Watch from over 2000 languages on any device and share it with others.
